definition: a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
every movement/each and every move
one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
success at one go/to succeed at the first attempt
every little move/every single movement
pinyin: yi1 ju3 shou3 yi1 tou2 zu2

definition: win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

sentences.english: The company boasts a lot of awards it received at international fairs.
sentences.chinese: 該公司在國際性會展上一舉攬獲數項大獎。

sentences.english: He gloried in his winning the championship.
We do know however that Susan Boyle will now get a shot at stardom.
sentences.chinese: 但我們確實知道的是波伊爾現在將一舉成名。

sentences.english: Baby angels see me climb, stop my tumbles every time.
sentences.chinese: 寶貝天使看着我醒來，跟隨者我的一舉一動。

sentences.english: You know there are many people tracking each and every move of Nokia.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，許多人追蹤着諾基亞的一舉一動。

sentences.english: Irrefutable evidence, we had the last one day every stronghold.
sentences.chinese: 鐵證如山，我方一舉拿下最後一個日僞據點。

sentences.english: "[The Danish text] destroyed two years of effort in one fell swoop," De Boer wrote.
sentences.chinese: 一舉摧毀了長達兩年的努力，”在信中德波爾寫道。

sentences.english: But concerns over intellectual property rights have proved to be unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 對於知識產權問題存在顧慮顯然多此一舉。

sentences.english: To talk about the beautiful sunset is to gild the lily.
sentences.chinese: 談論日落之美是多此一舉。

sentences.english: I do not dare wild hope China to win at one fell swoop, but hopes is peace.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢奢望中國一舉奪魁，但更希望的是和平。

sentences.english: On the People’s Daily website, Miao manages to come off as a staff reporter for the CCP’s top daily.
sentences.chinese: 在人民網上，苗一舉成爲這家“黨報”的在編記者。

sentences.english: V Don't you think it a double advantage for us?
sentences.chinese: 難道你不認爲這對我們來說是一件一舉兩得的事嗎？

sentences.english: This time around, he swept to the title in imperious style.
sentences.chinese: 而這一次，他橫掃賽場一舉奪冠。

sentences.english: No loss is a college student, conversation elegant, every act and every move all seem to be liberal and dignified.
sentences.chinese: 不虧是大學生，談吐文雅，一舉一動都顯得落落大方。

sentences.english: Ida: Well, can't it be both?
Three minutes till the biggest battle of our professional lives all comes down today.
sentences.chinese: 三分鐘之後，大家運動生涯的最關鍵一戰就在此一舉。

definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
to sweep away/to sweep across
champion/CL:個|个[ge4]
continuous/in a row/serial/consecutive
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
soon after
to attempt/to try/attempt/CL:種|种[zhong3]
immediately/presently/following which

to lock (a door)/to close with a latch/to lock into place/a lock/a latch/to lock a computer file (to prevent it being overwritten)/to lock (denying access to a computer system or device or files, e.g. by password-protection)/to focus attention on/to target
to obtain/to receive/to get
again and again/repeatedly
lit. to join hands/to act together
to march/to advance
to catch/to obtain/to capture
